learning_outcomes.description: Identify and appreciate the different aspects that compose the culture, history and society of Latin America and its connection to other cultures.
Reach an understanding of the ways in which Latin American peoples have represented themselves under different external influences.
Provide a conceptual foundation for further study in the area of Latin American Studies.

assessments.due_date:
WEEK 2 - 2/03/2026

WEEK 7 - 13/04/2026

WEEK 9 - 27/04/2026

WEEK 11 - 11/05/2026

WEEK 13 - 25/05/2026

All in-class quizzes will have a duration of 10-20 mins (depending on the number of multiple choice/short answer questions).
assessments.task_description:
There will be 5 Reading Comprehension Tasks. The rationale for this assessment exercise is to ensure that students undertake a full and comprehensive reading of prescribed texts so that they can engage and participate effectively and meaningfully in in-class discussion. The five (5) tasks will consist of multiple choice and short answer questions on the prescribed readings. Questions will have a total of 1 or 2 points (up to 10). All tests will have a duration of 10-20 mins (depending on the number of multiple choice/short answer questions).

The tasks will be held on the following weeks and dates:

In class task 1 - Week 2: 2 March. Chapter 2: Before Columbus by P. Warne, Return of the Indian (1994), Module 1 (PDF provided on Bb)

In class task 2 - Week 7: 13 April. Chapter 2: Encounter, by J.H. Chasteen, Born in Blood and Fire (2016), Module 2 (textbook chapter, not provided on Bb)

In class task 3 - Week 9: 27 April. Chapter 4: Independence, by J.H. Chasteen, Born in Blood and Fire (2016), Module 2 (textbook chapter, not provided on Bb)

In class task 4 - Week 11: 11 May. Chapter 9: Revolution, by J.H. Chasteen, Born in Blood and Fire (2016), Module 3 (textbook chapter, not provided on Bb)

In class task 5 - Week 13: 25 May. Introduction by J. Gonzalez, Harvest of Empire (2011), Module 3 (PDF provided on Bb)

STATEMENT ON AI & MT

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Handwritten time limited quizzes to be completed in-person during class time.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Module 1 - The Indigenous Pre-Columbian world and Indigenous peoples today
assessments.due_date:
30/03/2026 12:00 pm

  • Timed essay, handwritten during class
  • Start time: at the beginning of the class, i.e., 12pm, Monday WEEK 6
  • Duration: 90-minutes duration + 10 planning time (100 minutes)
  • Expected word count: 750 - 900 words
assessments.task_description:
In-class handwritten essay, commencing at 12pm

90 minute duration + 10 minutes planning time

Choose one of the topics below, refine and discuss in your essay:

  • Maya: Your essay may centre on one or more of these aspects: art, writing, Popol Wuj, women, rulers, social organisation, philosophy
  • Aztec: Your essay may centre on one or more of these aspects: art, historical accounts, social organisation, philosophy
  • Inca or other Andean cultures: Your essay may centre on one or more of these aspects: architecture, art, social organisation, historical accounts, philosophy
  • Indigenous peoples today: Your essay may centre on one or more of these aspects: contemporary struggle; philosophy, worldview, case study

These are general topics from which you should develop a focus question based on the topic and what has been mentioned/discussed in class. Some topic ideas will be suggested during the lectures. You should include lecture materials/content in your essay. Please indicate in the introduction of your essay why you chose the topic and how it relates to your own positioning (see Assessment Criteria on Blackboard). 750 - 900 words

STATEMENT ON AI & MT

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: -This is a paper-based essay, handwritten, completed and submitted in class.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.due_date:
22/05/2026 5:00 pm

-Friday, WEEK 12

-Your essay must be 1,500 words (minimum) and 1,600 words (maximum).

-You should include lecture materials/content in your essay when/if relevant. You should include a Reference list at the end of your essay.

-You must use APA (7th ed) author-date style, or Chicago 17th (notes and bibliography or author-date). If you want to use another style, talk to your lecturer (Roberto).

-Please indicate in the introduction of your essay why you chose the topic and how it relates to your own positioning (experience, capital, interests, lens). 

-Please use academic sources (books and journals from reliable databases such as ProQuest and Web of Knowledge, see below). Include at least 3 sources in the body of your essay.

-You can submit before the due date.
assessments.task_description:
Choose one of the topics below, refine and discuss in your essay:

1. Discuss the significance of the Reconquista in forging the Spanish Empire in the Americas.

2. The 'New World': Discovery, invasion, encounter or invention? Discuss.

These are general topics from which you should develop a focus question based on the topic and what has been mentioned/discussed in class. Some topic ideas will be suggested during the lectures. You should include lecture materials/content in your essay. Please indicate in the introduction of your essay why you chose the topic and how it relates to your own positioning.

Please submit your essay by 5pm on (or before) the due date through Turnitin.

STATEMENT ON AI & MT

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.

assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
15/06/2026 5:00 pm

-Monday, EXAM WEEK 2

-Your essay must be 1,500 words (minimum) and 1,600 words (maximum).

-You should include lecture materials/content in your essay when/if relevant. You should include a Reference list at the end of your essay.

-Please indicate in the introduction of your essay why you chose the topic and how it relates to your own positioning (experience, capital, interests, lens). 

-Please use academic sources (books and journals from reliable databases such as ProQuest and Web of Knowledge, see below). Include at least 3 sources in the body of your essay.

-You must use APA (7th ed) author-date style, or Chicago 17th (notes and bibliography or author-date).

-You can submit before the due date.
assessments.task_description:
Choose one of the topics below, refine and discuss in your essay:

1. What were the achievements and failures of the revolutionary movements in Latin America?

2. What are the achievements and challenges to Latin America's transition to democracy and/or US - Latin America relations in the 20th Century?

3. The border, mestizo consciousness, exiles: political/cultural analysis, Latino Politics, cultural representations of race in the US.

These are general topics from which you should develop a focus question based on the topic and what has been mentioned/discussed in class. Some topic ideas will be suggested during the lectures. You should include lecture materials/content in your essay. Please indicate in the introduction of your essay why you chose the topic and how it relates to your own positioning.

Please submit your essay by 5pm on (or before) the due date through Turnitin.

STATEMENT ON AI & MT

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.

Course presentation and cultural studies concepts

WEEK 1. Course presentation. The idea of Latin America and concepts such as cultural identity, imagined communities, periphery, epistemicide, modernity, decolonial thought. Assessment discussion and tips for essay writing. Introduction to Module 1
